recipe.title: Pesto Pasta
recipe.description: Simple pasta with fresh basil pesto and Parmesan

steps.descr: Cook pasta in salted boiling water
steps.instructions: Cook pasta in salted boiling water

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by cooking the pasta in a big pot of salted boiling water. Give it about ten minutes until it's al dente.

steps.descr: Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan
steps.instructions: Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan

on_enter.say: Now, let's make that beautiful pesto. Pop the basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan into a blender. Give it a whizz until it's nice and smooth.

steps.descr: Drizzle in olive oil while blending
steps.instructions: Drizzle in olive oil while blending

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now, while the blender is running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil. This will give your pesto that lovely, silky texture.

steps.descr: Season pesto with salt and pepper
steps.instructions: Season pesto with salt and pepper

on_enter.say: Let's season our pesto with a pinch of salt and a crack of black pepper. Taste it and adjust as you like.
Right, let's reserve a cup of that starchy pasta water, then drain the pasta. This water will help us loosen the pesto later.

steps.descr: Toss pasta with pesto, add pasta water to loosen
steps.instructions: Toss pasta with pesto, add pasta water to loosen

on_enter.say: Now, let's toss the pasta with that gorgeous pesto. Add a splash of the reserved pasta water to get it to the perfect consistency.

steps.descr: Serve with halved cherry tomatoes and extra Parmesan
steps.instructions: Serve with halved cherry tomatoes and extra Parmesan

on_enter.say: Finally, let's plate up! Serve your pasta with some halved cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of extra Parmesan. Enjoy your meal!

notes.text:
Toast pine nuts for deeper flavor
Pesto can be made ahead and frozen
Add a splash of lemon juice for brightness
